ai-sn28:1.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn28:1.1.2_0: Then Venerable Sāriputta robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
ai-sn28:1.1.3_0: He wandered for alms in Sāvatthī. After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Dark Forest,
ai-sn28:1.1.4_0: where she sat down at the foot of a tree for the day’s meditation.
ai-sn28:1.2.1_0: Then in the late afternoon, Sāriputta came out of retreat and went to Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn28:1.2.2_0: Venerable Ānanda saw him coming off in the distance,
ai-sn28:1.2.4_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.
ai-sn28:1.2.5_0: What did you stay in your dwelling?”
ai-sn28:1.3.1_0: “Reverend, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, I entered and remained in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-sn28:1.3.2_0: But it didn’t occur to me:
ai-sn28:1.3.3_0: ‘I am entering the first absorption’ or ‘I have entered the first absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the first absorption’.”
ai-sn28:1.3.4_0: “That must be because Venerable Sāriputta has long ago totally eradicated ego, possessiveness, and the underlying tendency to conceit.
ai-sn28:1.3.6_0: ‘I am entering the first absorption’ or ‘I have entered the first absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the first absorption’.”
ai-sn28:1.3.7_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-sn28:2.1.2_0: Venerable Ānanda saw Venerable Sāriputta and said to him:
ai-sn28:2.1.3_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.
ai-sn28:2.1.4_0: What did you stay in your dwelling?”
ai-sn28:2.2.1_0: “Reverend, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected were stilled, I entered and remained in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-sn28:2.2.2_0: But it didn’t occur to me:
ai-sn28:2.2.3_0: ‘I am entering the second absorption’ or ‘I have entered the second absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the second absorption’.”
ai-sn28:2.2.4_0: “That must be because Venerable Sāriputta has long ago totally eradicated ego, possessiveness, and the underlying tendency to conceit.
ai-sn28:2.2.6_0: ‘I am entering the second absorption’ or ‘I have entered the second absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the second absorption’.”
ai-sn28:3.1.3_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.
ai-sn28:3.1.4_0: What did you stay in your dwelling?”
ai-sn28:3.2.1_0: “Reverend, with the fading away of rapture, I entered and remained in the third absorption, where I meditated with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-sn28:3.2.1_1: And where I entered and remained in the third absorption, where I meditated with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-sn28:3.2.2_0: But it didn’t occur to me:
ai-sn28:3.2.3_0: ‘I am entering the third absorption’ or ‘I have entered the third absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the third absorption’.”
ai-sn28:3.2.4_0: “That must be because Venerable Sāriputta has long ago totally eradicated ego, possessiveness, and the underlying tendency to conceit.
ai-sn28:3.2.6_0: ‘I am entering the third absorption’ or ‘I have entered the third absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the third absorption’.”
ai-sn28:4.1.3_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.
ai-sn28:4.1.4_0: What did you stay in your dwelling?”
ai-sn28:4.2.1_0: “Reverend, with the giving up of pleasure and pain, and the ending of former happiness and sadness, I entered and remained in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-sn28:4.2.2_0: But it didn’t occur to me:
ai-sn28:4.2.3_0: ‘I am entering the fourth absorption’ or ‘I have entered the fourth absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the fourth absorption’.”
ai-sn28:4.2.4_0: “That must be because Venerable Sāriputta has long ago totally eradicated ego, possessiveness, and the underlying tendency to conceit.
ai-sn28:4.2.6_0: ‘I am entering the fourth absorption’ or ‘I have entered the fourth absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the fourth absorption’.”
ai-sn28:5.1.3_0: “Reverend, going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, I entered and remained in the dimension of infinite space. ...” ...
ai-sn28:5.1.4_0: whether the man has come up with.”
ai-sn28:6.1.3_0: “Reverend, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, I entered and remained in the dimension of infinite consciousness. ...” ...
ai-sn28:6.1.4_0: whether the man has come up.”

ai-sn28:8.1.3_0: “Reverend, going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, I entered and remained in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. ...” ...

ai-sn28:9.1.4_0: But it didn’t occur to me:
ai-sn28:9.1.5_0: ‘I am entering the cessation of perception and feeling’ or ‘I have entered the cessation of perception and feeling’ or ‘I am emerging from the cessation of perception and feeling’.”

ai-sn28:10.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-sn28:10.1.2_0: Then he robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Rājagaha for alms.
ai-sn28:10.1.3_0: After wandering indiscriminately for alms-food in Rājagaha, he ate his alms-food by a wall.
ai-sn28:10.1.4_0: Then the wanderer Sucimukhī went up to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-sn28:10.1.4_1: Then the Buddha said to him:
ai-sn28:10.2.3_0: “Well then, do you eat facing upwards?”
ai-sn28:10.2.5_0: “Well then, do you eat facing the cardinal directions?”
ai-sn28:10.2.7_0: “Well then, do you eat facing the intermediate directions?”
ai-sn28:10.3.1_0: “When asked if you eat facing all these directions, you answer ‘no, sister’.
ai-sn28:10.3.2_0: ‘Well then, ascetic, when asked facial directions, you answer ‘Yes.’
ai-sn28:10.3.3_0: ‘Well then, ascetic, eat facing the cardinal directions,’ that’s what I eat.
ai-sn28:10.3.4_0: ‘Well then, ascetic, eat facing the intermediate directions,’ that’s what I eat.
ai-sn28:10.4.1_0: How exactly do you eat, ascetic?”
ai-sn28:10.4.2_0: “Sister, those ascetics and brahmins who earn a living by geomancy—an unworthy branch of knowledge, a wrong livelihood—are said to eat facing downwards.
ai-sn28:10.4.3_0: Those ascetics and brahmins who earn a living by astrology—an unworthy branch of knowledge, a wrong livelihood—are said to eat facing upwards.
ai-sn28:10.4.4_0: Those ascetics and brahmins who earn a living by running errands and messages—a wrong livelihood—are said to eat facing the cardinal directions.
ai-sn28:10.4.5_0: Those ascetics and brahmins who earn a living by palmistry—an unworthy branch of knowledge, a wrong livelihood—are said to eat facing the intermediate directions.
ai-sn28:10.5.1_0: I don’t earn a living by any of these means.
ai-sn28:10.5.2_0: I seek alms in a principled manner,
ai-sn28:10.5.3_0: and I eat it in a principled manner.”
ai-sn28:10.6.1_0: Then Sucimukhī the wanderer went around Rājagaha from street to street, from square to square, and announced:
ai-sn28:10.6.2_0: “The Sakyan ascetics eat food in a principled manner!
ai-sn28:10.6.3_0: The Sakyan ascetics eat blameless food.
ai-sn28:10.6.4_0: Give almsfood to the Sakyan ascetics!”
ai-sn28:10.6.6_0: The first sub-chapter on Sāriputta is finished.
ai-sn28:10.7.7_0: The Linked Discourses on Sāriputta are complete.
